Class CombinedChart

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • com.github.mikephil.charting.charts.Chart<T>

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, BarDataProvider, BarLineScatterCandleBubbleDataProvider, BubbleDataProvider, CandleDataProvider, ChartInterface, LineDataProvider, ScatterDataProvider

    public class CombinedChart
extends BarLineChartBase<CombinedData>
implements LineDataProvider, BarDataProvider, ScatterDataProvider, CandleDataProvider, BubbleDataProvider
    This chart class allows the combination of lines, bars, scatter and candle data all displayed in one chart area.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CombinedChart.DrawOrder
      enum that allows to specify the order in which the different data objects for the combined-chart are drawn

      void setData(CombinedData data)
      Sets a new data object for the chart.
      void setDrawBarShadow(boolean enabled)
      If set to true, a grey area is drawn behind each bar that indicates the maximum value.
      void setDrawHighlightArrow(boolean enabled)
      set this to true to draw the highlightning arrow
      void setDrawOrder(CombinedChart.DrawOrder[] order)
      Sets the order in which the provided data objects should be drawn.
      void setDrawValueAboveBar(boolean enabled)
      If set to true, all values are drawn above their bars, instead of below their top.

        set this to true to draw the highlightning arrow
        Parameters:

      • setDrawValueAboveBar

        public void setDrawValueAboveBar(boolean enabled)
        If set to true, all values are drawn above their bars, instead of below their top.
        Parameters:
        enabled -

      • setDrawBarShadow

        public void setDrawBarShadow(boolean enabled)
        If set to true, a grey area is drawn behind each bar that indicates the maximum value. Enabling his will reduce performance by about 50%.
        Parameters:
        enabled -

      • getDrawOrder

        public CombinedChart.DrawOrder[] getDrawOrder()
        Returns the currently set draw order.
        Returns:

      • setDrawOrder

        public void setDrawOrder(CombinedChart.DrawOrder[] order)
        Sets the order in which the provided data objects should be drawn. The earlier you place them in the provided array, the further they will be in the background. e.g. if you provide new DrawOrer[] { DrawOrder.BAR, DrawOrder.LINE }, the bars will be drawn behind the lines.
        Parameters:
        order -
